Praise ye the LORD. Praise ye the name of the LORD; praise <FI>him<Fi>, O ye servants of the LORD.
Ye that stand in the house of the LORD, in the courts of the house of our God,
Praise the LORD; for the LORD <FI>is<Fi> good: sing praises unto his name; for <FI>it is<Fi> pleasant.
For the LORD hath chosen Jacob unto himself, <FI>and<Fi> Israel for his peculiar treasure.<CM>
For I know that the LORD <FI>is<Fi> great, and <FI>that<Fi> our Lord <FI>is<Fi> above all gods.
Whatsoever the LORD pleased, <FI>that<Fi> did he in heaven, and in earth, in the seas, and all deep places.
He causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth; he maketh lightnings for the rain; he bringeth the wind out of his treasuries.
Who smote the firstborn of Egypt, both of man and beast.<RF>both…: Heb. from man unto beast<Rf>
<FI>Who<Fi> sent tokens and wonders into the midst of thee, O Egypt, upon Pharaoh, and upon all his servants.
Who smote great nations, and slew mighty kings;
Sihon king of the Amorites, and Og king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan:
And gave their land <FI>for<Fi> an heritage, an heritage unto Israel his people.
Thy name, O LORD, <FI>endureth<Fi> for ever; <FI>and<Fi> thy memorial, O LORD, throughout all generations.<RF>throughout…: Heb. to generation and generation<Rf>
For the LORD will judge his people, and he will repent himself concerning his servants.<CM>
The idols of the heathen <FI>are<Fi> silver and gold, the work of men's hands.
They have mouths, but they speak not; eyes have they, but they see not;
They have ears, but they hear not; neither is there <FI>any<Fi> breath in their mouths.
They that make them are like unto them: <FI>so is<Fi> every one that trusteth in them.
Bless the LORD, O house of Israel: bless the LORD, O house of Aaron:
Bless the LORD, O house of Levi: ye that fear the LORD, bless the LORD.
Blessed be the LORD out of Zion, which dwelleth at Jerusalem. Praise ye the LORD.<CM>
